work.name: [Six to Start](https://www.sixtostart.com/)
work.description: Refactored the whole _Zombies Run_ app using [The Composable Architecture](https://github.com/pointfreeco/swift-composable-architecture/), SwiftUI and Swift Concurrency. Modularised the project with SPM and created preview apps for ease of development and testing. Reimplemented in-app purchases using StoreKit 2 and provided Combine-based wrappers for other layers (Core Location, data access, Network Path Monitor etc). Before that, refactored the Home Screen to use _modern_ collection views (diffable data sources and compositional layout), helped transition to RxSwift and RxCocoa, improved overall accessibility (voice over, dynamic fonts) and prepared the app for localisation.

work.name: [ZuluTrade](https://www.zulutrade.com/)
work.description: Introduced a reactive and unidirectional architecture using RxSwift and [ReactorKit](https://github.com/ReactorKit/ReactorKit). Refactored the networking layer providing reactive extensions ([Moya](https://github.com/Moya/Moya) and [Starscream](https://github.com/daltoniam/Starscream)) and gathered business logic to a dedicated layer. Improved the infrastructure for creating 'white labels' and organised external and internal dependencies with CocoaPods. Set up CI (Jenkins and Fastlane) automating internal builds for multiple environments and targets. Implemented large features (push notifications, dashboard, profile comments and status updates, follow). Communication with Product Owners, QA and Designers, as well as empowering the team and mentoring.

work.name: [Magnetic Pull](https://www.magneticpull.org/)
work.description: Built a few apps from the ground up (Cook Planner, The Region of Attica) and helped with maintenance, bug fixing and new features for others (Cosmote What's Up, Home Run). Responsible for enrolling to the Developer Program as well as TestFlight and App Store distribution.

work.name: [EF Labs](https://www.ef.com/)
work.description: Involved in the project from early prototyping to main development and distribution. Clarified specifications and helped define backend APIs. Contributed in shaping the team culture, collaboration with the Android lead and mentoring. Set up CI for QA builds and maintained App Store releases. Participated in Usability Testing sessions and provided feedback to the User Experience lead.

work.name: [Daresy](https://daresay.co/)
work.description: Worked on a number of internal apps (Reseräkning, Edströmska, Efterlysta, All Access, iJust) as well as a consultant for external clients (Försäkringskassan, Ericsson, Assa Abloy, NRJ Radio, Widespace). Responsible for the Interaction Design and full development lifecycle of most projects.

projects.title: PoNR / Anomie
projects.description: Participation in the list of curated works for [Athens Digital Arts Festival (ADAF18)](https://2018.adaf.gr/events/ponr-anomie/) as member of the group “Plastik”. Implemented a key part of the piece, an iPad application developed in Unity3D, using Vuforia for the AR functionality. A Raspberry Pi and OpenCV were used to capture an image of the viewer's face, which would be sent wirelessly to the app, becoming part of the augmented content seen through the iPad.

projects.title: Shutter Cam - Personalised Live Filters
projects.description: [Shutter](https://apple.co/498suhy) is an iOS app that allows users to combine image filters and either apply them while taking a picture or use them to edit existing photos. The result is previewed in real time and it is possible to create, edit and save custom sets of creative filters ('lenses') for later use. The app is written in Objective-C and uses Core Data and GPUImage.
